text: Hi All, I thank you to accept me in the group.
I am a new HubSpot developer and I have to work on the development of template...I know I can't work on the design of the template from the HubSpot platform and I am working from VS
I would like to know if it' s possible to add a CSS file in this case and work on the design,

hey there. I think there may be some things you have confused.

You absolutely can work on the design of the templates building them out how you want them and styling using CSS.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides#getting-started>

There are several tutorials here that can help you get familiar with the platform. If you’re working in VS Code, highly recommend reviewing the “creating an efficient development workflow” guide. Getting started with themes, and getting started with modules.
For a good overview of the CMS and how the pieces fit together I recommend checking out the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/key-concepts|key concepts>
Yeah, I think it is related to that if I recall. I wish the filters worked, it would be nice to be able to control it.
You can use CSS but that would mean a hand coded template so you'd miss out on the drag and drop features (which are apparently being worked on - release date unknown).
